column2: hydro1 <- ggplot(data = LRRK2, aes(x = Position, y = `Combined Surrounding Hydrophobicity`)) + geom_step(size = 0.25) + scale_x_continuous(name = "Amino Acid Number", limits = c(0, 2527), breaks = seq(0, 2527, by = 30)) + theme(aspect.ratio = 0.1) +  geom_point(data = vars, aes(x = vars$`AA Num`, y = vars$`Combined Surrounding Hydrophobicity`, col = "red", text = paste("Variant:", vars$Variant)) )
hyd <-ggplotly(p = hydro1, layerData = 2, tooltip = c("text", "`Combined Surrounding Hydrophobicity`" ))
Aspect ratios aren't yet implemented, but you can manually set a suitable height/width
